gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Bacteria Monitoring Stations and Data Summaries, Derived from EPA BASINS 3: Indiana, 2003

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: (compiler and editor): Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: BACTERIA_MONITORING_EPA_IN is a point shapefile developed by the USEPA BASINS 3.0 program and edited by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates. Joinable tables must be utilized to access readings at specific stations for specific parameters. Tables are 5 year summaries of station data. Points represent monitoring stations within Indiana as well as within 0.5 miles of the state boundary. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - This data set provides a location map in ARCVIEW Shapefile format of selected water quality monitoring stations for 10 bacteria-related parameters. The stations and the monitoring data are extracted from the U.S. EPA Storage and Retrieval of US Waters Parametric Data (STORET) which is contributed to by a number of organizations including federal, state, interstate agencies, universities, contractors, individuals and water laboratories. Data updates to STORET area performed weekly. Each provider of data is responsible for the data it submits to STORET. The geographic coordinates for monitoring stations were obtained using USGS 1:24,000 - 1:100,000-scale topographic map (depending on map availability).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide general information on water quality at monitoring stations in Indiana. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "The STORET database serves as a repository of waterway parametric data, including information on ambient, intensive survey, effluent and biological water quality."

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Statewide GIS database was produced under an Indiana Department of Transportation contract. Data is from the USEPA, BASINS 3.0.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This is a small scale national database and positional error does exist. Use should be limited to broad planning and information, however, completeness and horizontal position issues prohibit this digital file from replacing field review for final decision making. This data set was compiled by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. CREDIT Please acknowledge USEPA. The data was developed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency as part of BASINS 3.0

No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY The product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Data was obtained from the USEPA BASINS 3.0 Region 5 CD, <http://www.epa.gov/OST/BASINS/>, and was developed by the USEPA, Office of Water, OST. The development of the source data had no relationship to the Indiana Statewide GIS Database.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Some points overlap but each appears to have a unique identification although no formal tests were performed.
No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata.

No information was included in original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Accessory summary tables appear to be dated and more recent data readings may be available from the BASINS website or contacting the USEPA. A few errors in the "County" field were found and corrected during horizontal accuracy checks, however, more may exist that were undiscovered.

Observing positional accuracy suggests that this layer is best used at smaller scales (suggest >1:45,000). Larger scales may present the problem of the point not being located directly on the stream where it is actually located. Positions were checked by querying for the county attributes and visual adjustments were made by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates when deemed helpful. An "Accuracy" field was added to track these tests and changes which are summarized as the following: 0 - untested or no error found, 1-3 located outside the attributed county, it is unknown if the location or the county attribute is in error; 5-6 located aside of the stream of location 1 - outside the attributed county but very nearby; uncorrected (2/634) 2 - outside the attributed county but within an adjacent county; uncorrected (9/634) 3 - outside the attributed county, more than one county away; uncorrected (2/634) 5 - within the attributed county, aside the stream of location; uncorrected (15/634) 6 - within the attributed county, aside the stream of location; corrected (55/634)
No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Vertical accuracy does not appear to be a factor in the digital production of the data set.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "The BASINS Bacteria Monitoring Stations and Data Summaries for the conterminous U.S. are created by retrieving the source data from the STORET database using the STORET MEAN program. Monitoring stations characterized as ambient stream, lake, reservoir, canal, estuary or ocean were selected. Summary statistics were computed by the program by station for 5-year intervals from 1970-1997. Statistics include number of observations, standard deviation, mean, 15th, 25th, 50th, 75th and 85th percentiles. A BASINS water quality station ID was assigned to each station in order to facilitate links and joins within BASINS between station data and the monitoring data summary. The geographic coordinates for monitoring stations are obtained using USGS 1:24,000 - 1:100,000-scale topographic map (depending on map availability). Bacteria monitoring station coordinates were screened for acceptance based on whether the station was located within the USGS Hydrologic Cataloging Unit boundaries associated with its EPA region. Bacteria stations located outside the boundaries were not included in this BASINS data product."

A file named bac_stat was obtained by Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates from the USEPA BASINS 3.0 Region 5 CD, <http://www.epa.gov/OST/BASINS/>. The file was clipped to within 0.5 miles of the Indiana boundary and transformed from Geographic to UTM, Zone 16, meters. Accuracy checks were performed by querying all the points attributed for a given county and comparing their locations. Results of query tests and visual editing is documented in the "Accuracy" field which was added. The following fields were deleted from original because editing in other areas often made it erroneous - Stfips, Long, Lat, Stcofips, and Type.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
